    "patch": "@@ -1,81 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Configure Verified ID by AU10TIX as your Identity Verification Partner \n-description: This article shows you the steps you need to follow to configure AU10TIX as your identity verification partner.\n-author: barclayn\n-manager: femila\n-ms.service: entra-verified-id\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 01/17/2025\n-ms.author: barclayn\n-# Customer intent: As a developer, I'm looking for information about the open standards that are supported by Microsoft Entra Verified ID.\n----\n-\n-# Configure Verified ID by AU10TIX as your Identity Verification Partner\n-\n-In this article, we cover the steps needed to integrate Microsoft Entra Verified ID with [AU10TIX](https://www.au10tix.com/). AU10TIX is an automated solution for the verification of ID documents + biometrics. AU10TIX supports the verification of documents in over 190 regions reading documents in their regional languages.\n-\n-To learn more about AU10TIX and its complete set of solutions, visit https://www.au10tix.com/.\n-\n-## Prerequisites\n-\n- You need to meet the following requirements before you can continue with the steps in this article:\n-\n-- A tenant [configured](verifiable-credentials-configure-tenant.md) for Microsoft Entra Verified ID service.\n-    - If you don't have an existing tenant, you can [create an Azure account for free](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/?WT.mc_id=A261C142F).\n-- You first need to complete the onboarding process with Au10tix.\n-    - To create a AU10TIX account, submit the form on this [page](https://www.au10tix.com/solutions/verifiable-credentials/).\n-\n-\n->[!IMPORTANT]\n-> Before you proceed, you must have a URL from Au10Tix for users to be issued Verified IDs. If you don't have it, follow up with Au10Tix before you attempt to follow the steps in this article.\n-\n-## Scenario description\n-\n-When onboarding users you can remove the need for error prone manual onboarding steps by using Verified ID with A10TIX account onboarding. Verified IDs can be used to digitally onboard employees, students, citizens, or others to securely access resources and services. For example, rather than an employee needing to go to a central office to activate an employee badge, they can use a Verified ID to verify their identity to activate a badge that is delivered to them remotely. Rather than a citizen receiving a code they must redeem to access governmental services, they can use a Verified ID to prove their identity and gain access. Learn more about [account onboarding](./plan-verification-solution.md#account-onboarding).\n-\n-\n-\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/verified-id-partner-au10tix/vc-solution-architecture-diagram.png\" alt-text=\"Diagram of the verifiable credential solution.\":::\n-\n-\n-## Configure your Application to use AU10TIX Verified ID\n-\n-For incorporating identity verification into your Apps, using AU10TIX  \"Government Issued ID - Global\" Verified ID follow these steps:\n-\n-### Part 1\n-\n-As a developer you can share these steps with your tenant administrator to obtain the verification request URL, and body for your application or website to request Verified IDs from your users.\n-\n-1. Go to [Microsoft Entra admin center -> Verified ID](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_DecentralizedIdentity/ResourceOverviewBlade). \n-\n-   >[!NOTE]\n-   > Make sure this tenant is the one where you set up Verified ID per the prerequisites.\n-\n-1. Select QuickStart > Verification Request > [Start](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_DecentralizedIdentity/QuickStartVerifierBlade)\n-1. Choose **Select Issuer**.\n-1. Look for AU10TIX in the **Search/select issuers** drop-down.\n-\n-   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/verified-id-partner-au10tix/select-issuers.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the portal section used to choose issuers.\":::\n-\n-1. Check the **Government Issued ID – Global** or other credential type.\n-1. Select **Add** and then select **Review**.\n-1. Download the request body and Copy/paste POST API request URL.\n-\n-### Part 2\n-\n-As a developer you now have the request URL and body from your tenant admin, follow these steps to update your application or website:\n-\n-1. To request Verified IDs from your users, include the request URL and body in your application or website. \n-   >[!Note]\n-   >If you are using [one of the sample apps](https://aka.ms/vcsample), you'll need to replace the contents of the `presentation_request_config.json` with the request body obtained in [Part 1](#part-1). The sample code overwrites the `trustedIssuers` values with `IssuerAuthority` value from `appsettings.json`. Copy the `trustedIssuers` value from the payload to `IssuerAuthority` in `appsettings.json` file.\n-1. Be sure to replace the values for the **URL**, **state**, and **api-key** with your respective values.\n-1. [Grant permissions](verifiable-credentials-configure-tenant.md#grant-permissions-to-get-access-tokens) to your app to obtain access token for the Verified ID service request service principal.\n-\n-## Test the user flow\n-\n-User flow is specific to your application or website. However if you use one of the sample apps follow the steps outlined as part of the [sample app's documentation](https://aka.ms/vcsample).\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- [Verifiable credentials admin API](admin-api.md)\n-- [Request Service REST API issuance specification](issuance-request-api.md)"
  },

    "patch": "@@ -1,72 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Configure LexisNexis Risk Solutions as an identity verification partner using Verified ID\n-description: This article shows you the steps you need to follow to configure LexisNexis as your identity verification partner.\n-author: barclayn\n-manager: femila\n-ms.service: entra-verified-id\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 01/17/2025\n-ms.author: barclayn\n-# Customer intent: As a developer, I'm looking for information about the open standards that are supported by Microsoft Entra Verified ID.\n----\n-\n-# Configure Verified ID with LexisNexis as your Identity Verification Partner\n-\n-You can use Microsoft Entra Verified ID with LexisNexis Risk Solutions to enable faster onboarding by replacing some human interactions. Verifiable Credentials (VCs) can be used to onboard employees, students, citizens, or others to access services.\n-\n-## Prerequisites\n-\n-- A tenant [configured](verifiable-credentials-configure-tenant.md) for Microsoft Entra Verified ID service.\n-    - If you don't have an existing tenant, you can [create an Azure account for free](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/?WT.mc_id=A261C142F).\n-- Your tenant should first complete the LexisNexis onboarding process.\n-    - Create a LexisNexis account, you can request a [demo](https://solutions.risk.lexisnexis.com/did-microsoft). Expect response from your LexisNexis Risk Solutions within 48 hours.\n-\n->[!IMPORTANT]\n-> Before you proceed, you must first have the URL from LexisNexis risk solutions for users to be issued Verified IDs. If you don't receive it, follow up with LexisNexis before you attempt to follow these steps.\n-\n-## Scenario description\n-\n-Verifiable Credentials can be used to onboard employees, students, citizens, or others to access services. For example, rather than an employee needing to go to a central office to activate an employee badge, they can use a verifiable credential to verify their identity to activate a badge that is delivered to them remotely. Rather than a citizen receiving a code they must redeem to access governmental services, they can use a VC to prove their identity and gain access. Learn more about [account onboarding](./plan-verification-solution.md#account-onboarding). \n-\n-\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/verified-id-partner-au10tix/vc-solution-architecture-diagram.png\" alt-text=\"Diagram of the verifiable credential solution.\":::\n-\n-## Configure your application to use LexisNexis\n-\n-To incorporate identity verification into your Apps using LexisNexis Verified ID, follow these steps.\n-\n-### Part 1\n-\n-As a developer you need to share the steps in this section with your tenant administrator. These instructions help them get the verification request URL, and application body or website to request verifiable credentials from your users.\n-\n-1. Go to [Microsoft Entra admin center -> Verified ID](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_DecentralizedIdentity/ResourceOverviewBlade).\n-    >[!Note]\n-    > Make sure this is the tenant you set up for Verified ID per the pre-requisites.\n-1. Go to [Quickstart-> Verification Request -> Start](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_DecentralizedIdentity/QuickStartVerifierBlade).\n-1. Select on **Select Issuer**.\n-1. Look for LexisNexis in the Search/select issuers drop-down. \n-   \n-   [ :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/verified-id-partner-lexisnexis/select-issuer.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the select issuer section of the portal showing LexisNexis as the choice.\":::](./media/verified-id-partner-lexisnexis/select-issuer.png#lightbox)\n-   \n-1. Check the credential type you discussed with LexisNexis Customer success manager for your specific needs.\n-1. Choose **Add** and then choose **Review**.\n-1. Download the request body and Copy/paste POST API request URL.\n-\n-### Part 2\n-\n-As a developer you now have the request URL and body from your tenant admin, follow these steps to update your application or website:\n-\n-1. To request Verified IDs from your users, include the request URL and body in your application or website. \n-   >[!Note]\n-   >If you are using [one of the sample apps](https://aka.ms/vcsample), you'll need to replace the contents of the `presentation_request_config.json` with the request body obtained in [Part 1](#part-1). The sample code overwrites the `trustedIssuers` values with `IssuerAuthority` value from `appsettings.json`. Copy the `trustedIssuers` value from the payload to `IssuerAuthority` in `appsettings.json` file.\n-1. Replace the values for the **URL**, **state**, and **api-key** with your respective values.\n-1. Grant your app [permissions](verifiable-credentials-configure-tenant.md#grant-permissions-to-get-access-tokens) to obtain an access token for the Verified ID service request service principal.\n-\n-## Test the user flow\n-\n-User flow is specific to your application or website. However if you are using [one of the sample apps](https://aka.ms/vcsample) follow the steps here - [Run the test the sample app](https://aka.ms/vcsample)\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- [Verifiable credentials admin API](admin-api.md)\n-- [Request Service REST API issuance specification](issuance-request-api.md)"
  },

    "patch": "@@ -1,70 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Configure Verified ID by IDEMIA as your identity verification partner \n-description: This article shows you the steps you need to follow to configure IDEMIA as your identity verification partner.\n-author: barclayn\n-manager: femila\n-ms.service: entra-verified-id\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/30/2025\n-ms.author: barclayn\n-# Customer intent: As a developer, I'm looking for information about the open standards that are supported by Microsoft Entra Verified ID.\n----\n-\n-# Configure Verified ID by IDEMIA as your identity verification partner\n-\n-In this article, we cover the steps needed to integrate Microsoft Entra Verified ID (Verified ID) with [IDEMIA](https://www.idemia.com/).\n-\n-## Prerequisites\n-\n-Before you can continue, you need to meet the following requirements: \n-\n-- A tenant configured with Verified ID.\n-   - If you don't have an existing tenant, you can create an Azure account for free. \n-- You need to first complete the onboarding process with IDEMIA. \n-   - Register on the IDEMIA Experience Portal where you can create your own Microsoft verifiable credential application with a few steps low code integration. \n-\n->[!IMPORTANT]\n->Before you can proceed, you must have already received a URL from IDEMIA. If you haven't yet received it, follow up with IDEMIA before you try the steps documented below.\n-\n-\n-## Scenario description\n-\n-Verified ID users can have their identity verified using IDEMIA's identity document capture and verification.\n-The Identity proofing process is completed using biometric and document capture via the users' smartphones. Once a user submits their data, biometric and document data is extracted and verified against one another, or against an authoritative data source such as a national identity database or a trusted system of record. Counter-fraud and high-risk profile verification could also be performed for additional assurance. \n-\n-The result is a trusted user identity that gives service providers the assurance they need to proceed with customer onboarding. \n-\n-\n-After verification, users are issued a reusable identity credential, which expedites the onboarding process for employees, partners, and customers​.\n-\n-\n-## Configure IDEMIA as your identity verification proofing solution\n-\n-To configure IDEMIA as your identity verification proofing solution, follow these steps:\n-\n-1. In the Microsoft Entra admin center, locate **Verified ID** in the left hand menu and select **Overview**.\n-1. Select **Explore** and select **Verification request**.\n-1. Choose **Select issuer(s)** and select **Select first issuer**.\n-1. Look for **IDEMIA** in the search/select issuers drop down.\n-1. Select **VerifiedIdentity** as the credential type.\n-1. Select **Add** and then select **Review**.\n-1. Download the request body and copy/paste the POST API request URL\n-\n-## Developer steps\n-\n-As a developer you now have the request URL and body from your tenant admin, follow these steps to update your application or website:\n-\n-1. Add the request URL and body to your application or website to request Verified IDs from your users.\n-    >[!IMPORTANT]\n-    >If you are using one of the sample apps, you'll need to replace the contents of the presentation_request_config.json with the request body obtained in Part 1. The sample code overwrites the trustedIssuers values with IssuerAuthority value from ```appsettings.json```. Copy the trustedIssuers value from the payload to IssuerAuthority in ```appsettings.json``` file.\n-2. Replace the **URL** and **api key** values with your own values.\n-3. [Grant permissions](verifiable-credentials-configure-tenant.md#grant-permissions-to-get-access-tokens) to your app so it can obtain an access token for the Verified ID service request service principal.\n-\n-## Test the user flow\n-\n-User flow is specific to your application or website. However, if you are using one of the sample apps follow the steps outlined as part of the sample app's documentation.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- [Verifiable credentials admin API](admin-api.md)\n-- [Request Service REST API issuance specification](issuance-request-api.md)"
  },

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fverified-id%2Fpartner-vu.md?ref=6da18135b57c75860b4eeb0a0732b9db3800de06",
    "patch": "@@ -1,97 +0,0 @@\n----\r\n-title: Configure Microsoft Entra Verified ID with VU Security Digital Identity as your Identity Verification Partner\r\n-description: Configure Microsoft Entra Verified ID with VU Digital Identity as your Identity Verification Partner.\r\n-author: gargi-sinha\r\n-manager: martinco\r\n-ms.service: entra-verified-id\r\n-ms.topic: how-to\r\n-ms.date: 06/18/2024\r\n-ms.author: gasinh\r\n-# Customer intent: As a developer, I'm looking for information about the open standards supported by Microsoft Entra Verified ID.\r\n----\r\n-\r\n-# Configure Microsoft Entra Verified ID with VU Security Digital Identity as your Identity Verification Partner\r\n-\r\n-In this article, learn to integrate [Microsoft Entra Verified ID](decentralized-identifier-overview.md) with [VU Security](https://www.vusecurity.com/) Digital Identity to create secure and frictionless digital experiences. Enhance biometric onboarding and verification scenarios throughout the lifecycle of citizens and organizations.\r\n-\r\n-Digital Identity has flexible onboarding, authentication, and verification processes on devices. It improves user experience and security without affecting business processes.\r\n-\r\n-## Prerequisites\r\n-\r\n-To get started, ensure the following prerequisites are met:\r\n-\r\n-- A tenant [configured](./verifiable-credentials-configure-tenant.md) for Microsoft Entra Verified ID.\r\n-\r\n-  - Use a tenant, or [create an Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/?WT.mc_id=A261C142F) for free.\r\n-\r\n-- Complete the Digital Identity onboarding process.\r\n-\r\n-- To create an account, go to [VU Security](https://www.vusecurity.com/) and select **Contact**.\r\n-\r\n-   >[!Important]\r\n-   >To proceed, use the VU Security-provided URL for users to be issued Verified IDs. \r\n-\r\n-## Scenario description\r\n-\r\n-Digital Identity is a link between users who need to access an application and applications that require secure access control, regardless of how users access the system.\r\n-\r\n-To enable faster and easier user onboarding, replace some human interactions with verifiable credentials. For a user to create or remotely access an account, enable Verified ID with Digital Identity. Verify identity without using vulnerable or complex passwords, or require users to be on-site.\r\n-\r\n-Learn more about [account onboarding](./plan-verification-solution.md#account-onboarding).\r\n-\r\n-In this account onboarding scenario, Digital Identity plays the Trusted ID proofing issuer role.\r\n-\r\n-   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-vu/vc-solution-architecture-diagram.png\" alt-text=\"Diagram of the verifiable credential solution.\":::\r\n-\r\n-## Configure applications to use Digital Identity\r\n-\r\n-Incorporate Digital Identity into your apps.\r\n-\r\n-### Select issuer\r\n-\r\n-As a developer you can share these steps with your tenant administrator to obtain the verification request URL, and body for your application or website to request Verified IDs from your users.\r\n-\r\n-1. Go to the Microsoft Entra admin center - [**Verified ID**](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_DecentralizedIdentity/ResourceOverviewBlade)\r\n-\r\n-   >[!TIP]\r\n-   >Confirm the tenant configured for Verified ID meets prerequisites.\r\n-\r\n-2. Go to **Quickstart**\r\n-3. Select **Verification Request**.\r\n-4. Select [**Start**](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_DecentralizedIdentity/QuickStartVerifierBlade).\r\n-5. Select **Select Issuer**.\r\n-6. In Search, in the **Issuers** drop-down, find **VU Security**.\r\n-\r\n-   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"./media/partner-vu/select-issuers.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the portal section used to choose issuers.\":::\r\n-\r\n-7. Compare the **VUIdentityCard** credential with attributes such as firstname, lastname, number, country, region, gender, birth date, nationality. etc.\r\n-\r\n-   >[!NOTE]\r\n-   >Number attribute refers to a national ID. For example, the Documento Nacional de Identidad (DNI) in Argentina.\r\n-\r\n-8. Select **Add**.\r\n-9. Select **Review**.\r\n-10. Download the request body.\r\n-11. Copy/paste POST API request URL.\r\n-\r\n-### Update an application or website\r\n-\r\n-With the request URL and body from the tenant administrator, update your application or website.\r\n-\r\n-1. To request Verified IDs from your users, add the request URL and body to your application or website.\r\n-\r\n-   >[!NOTE]\r\n-   >If you're using [a sample app](https://aka.ms/vcsample), replace the contents of the `presentation_request_config.json` with the request body obtained in the previous instructions. The sample code overwrites the `trustedIssuers` values with `IssuerAuthority` value from `appsettings.json`.\r\n-\r\n-2. Copy the `trustedIssuers` value from the payload to `IssuerAuthority` in the `appsettings.json` file.\r\n-3. Replace the values for **url**, **state**, and **api-key** with your values.\r\n-4. To obtain an access token for the Verified ID service request Service Principal, [grant needed permissions](verifiable-credentials-configure-tenant.md#grant-permissions-to-get-access-tokens) for your app.\r\n-\r\n-## Test the user flow\r\n-\r\n-User flow is specific to your application or website. However, with a sample app, see [related documentation](https://aka.ms/vcsample).\r\n-\r\n-## Next steps\r\n-\r\n-- [Verifiable credentials admin API](admin-api.md)\r\n-- [Request Service REST API issuance specification](issuance-request-api.md)\r"
  },

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the documentation for Microsoft Entra Verified ID. It consolidates multiple partner pages into a single `idv-partners.md` file and redirects the old paths accordingly. Additionally, several files have had minor updates, including corrections to manager fields and slight rephrasing in the "What's New" section, along with the addition of new content regarding September 2025 updates.
